story.text: (Adds closing high)TOKYO Jan 4 (Reuters) - The Nikkei average rose 0.74 percent to close at an eight-month closing high on Thursday, the first trading day of 2007, with Toyota Motor Corp. (7203.T) rising on news that it became one of the Big Three automakers in 2006 and other exporters advanced on a softer yen. Tokyo markets were open for a half day of business on Thursday from 09:00-11:00 a.m. (0000 GMT-0200 GMT). They were closed Monday through Wednesday for the New Year's holidays. Investors also bought NTT DoCoMo Inc. (9437.T) after the Nikkei business daily said Japan's largest mobile operator would keep initial investment in its so-called super 3G network down to 100-200 billion yen, which may enable DoCoMo to cut its fees and help retain users. [ID:nT142263] The Nikkei finished up 127.84 points at 17,353.67, the highest close since April 21. The broader TOPIX index .TOPX rose 1.06 percent to 1,698.95.
story.title: nikkei kicks off new year with 8 - month closing high
